title: How to Change Wallpaper in Windows 10

steps.headline: Right-click an empty space on the desktop.
steps.description: Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Click Personalize.
steps.description: This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Click the box beneath the "Background" heading.
Exit the "Personalization" window to see your new background.
steps.description: To do so, click the X in the top-right corner of the page. Your selected wallpaper option will have automatically been applied to the desktop when you changed the settings.

sentences: Right-click an empty space on the desktop.
Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu.
This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu.
Click the box beneath the "Background" heading.

You can click one of the following options:

Picture - Allows you to select a picture to display on your desktop.
A bunch of recent and sample pictures will be listed and can be used by clicking one.
You can also click Browse and choose a picture if you don't like the stock photos.
Furthermore, you can click the box beneath "Choose a fit" to change the way the picture is displayed (e.g., filling your entire screen).

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Solid color - Allows you to select a solid color (e.g., gray) to fill your Windows desktop.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/aid6626514-v4-728px-Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Slideshow - Displays a series of photos from your computer's default "Pictures" folder in a slideshow.
You can change this folder by clicking Browse and selecting a new folder.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/ca\/Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/c\/ca\/Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/aid6626514-v4-728px-Change-Your-Desktop-Background-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} It's best to make new folder dedicated for your desktop background slideshow that contains the pictures you want as a background.
For example, you could create a folder called "Desktop Slideshow" under the "Pictures" section of File Explorer.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/71\/Change-Wallpaper-in-Windows-10-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Change-Wallpaper-in-Windows-10-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/71\/Change-Wallpaper-in-Windows-10-Step-12.jpg\/aid6626514-v4-728px-Change-Wallpaper-in-Windows-10-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Exit the "Personalization" window to see your new background.
To do so, click the X in the top-right corner of the page.
Your selected wallpaper option will have automatically been applied to the desktop when you changed the settings.
